robotcontrol

Class RobotController

  • java.lang.Object
    • robotcontrol.RobotController

  • public class RobotController
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RobotController()
      Constructor takes no parameters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void executeProgram(ScheduleProgram program)
      Reads the list of maneuvers in given program and iterates through them sending then to programedManeuver() to be executed while doing so.
      void listenToInput()
      Contains the while loop (terminatable by pressing ESCAPE on the EV3) that checks for user input from the IR sensor and delegates the received input accordingly to the appropriate methods.
      void moveFist(int direction)
      Swings the fist around according to given parameters.
      void moveTracks(int direction)
      Moves the tracks according to given parameters.
      void obstacleHit()
      Stops the motors and reverses them half a turn before letting the user continue driving.
      void programmedManeuver(int maneuver)
      Executes maneuvers requested by executeProgram().
      void runProgram()
      The basic functionality of the program: Asks if the user wants to drive or schedule a program.
      ScheduleProgram scheduledProgram()
      Contains the menu in which the schedulable program and the time waited before execution are determined and executed.
      int scheduledProgramWaitTime()
      Menu for determining the length of the waiting period before executing selected program.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • RobotController

        public RobotController()
        Constructor takes no parameters. Starts the infra red sensor checker.

    • Method Detail

      • runProgram

        public void runProgram()
        The basic functionality of the program: Asks if the user wants to drive or schedule a program. Those functions are performed in separate functions.

      • listenToInput

        public void listenToInput()
        Contains the while loop (terminatable by pressing ESCAPE on the EV3) that checks for user input from the IR sensor and delegates the received input accordingly to the appropriate methods.

        Also checks if touch sensor is activated. If it is, starts the obstacleHit() method which stops the robot and reverses a bit.

      • scheduledProgram

        public ScheduleProgram scheduledProgram()
        Contains the menu in which the schedulable program and the time waited before execution are determined and executed.

      • scheduledProgramWaitTime

        public int scheduledProgramWaitTime()
        Menu for determining the length of the waiting period before executing selected program.
        Returns:
        int The selected waiting time as an integer

      • moveTracks

        public void moveTracks(int direction)
        Moves the tracks according to given parameters.
        Parameters:
        direction - int Integer that determines the direction of movement.

      • moveFist

        public void moveFist(int direction)
        Swings the fist around according to given parameters.
        Parameters:
        direction - int Integer that defines the direction in which to move the fist.

      • obstacleHit

        public void obstacleHit()
        Stops the motors and reverses them half a turn before letting the user continue driving.

      • executeProgram

        public void executeProgram(ScheduleProgram program)
        Reads the list of maneuvers in given program and iterates through them sending then to programedManeuver() to be executed while doing so.
        Parameters:
        program - ScheduleProgram The program which is to be executed.

      • programmedManeuver

        public void programmedManeuver(int maneuver)
        Executes maneuvers requested by executeProgram().
        Parameters:
        maneuver - int The numeric case number for the next executable maneuver.
